intro: Henriettella macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered henriettella, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, large, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a velvety texture, while the stems are covered in fine hairs. Henriettella macrocalyx is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses due to its striking floral display.
